psql is a command line tool that is installed alongside PostgreSQL DB, but since we've always been running PostgreSQL in a container, you've only got `pgcli`, which lacks the feature to run a sql script into the DB. Besides, having a command line for each database flavor you'll have to deal with as a Data Professional is far from ideal.
So, instead, you can use usql. Check the docs for details on how to install for your OS. On macOS, it supports `homebrew`, and on Windows, it supports scoop.
So, to run the taxi_trips.sql script with usql:
question: psql - command not found: psql (alternative install)
